At 04:12 19/05/2004, you wrote:
>No, I don't understand your objective.  Mine is clear
>and simple, to demonstrate that a recurrent neural
>network can do what animals frequently do, which is
>remember a sequence of patterns, and then recall them
>in order.  The telephone dialing task is an easy to
>understand example of this.  (and most people can hear
>a 7 digit number and immediately dial it, showing that
>they remembered it at least briefly.)  Animals do it
>when they remember a route and then find their way
>back.  I'm not aware that this has been done by any
>ANN researcher.  I plan to do it after my next two
>releases, so It's likely to be in the early fall.  One
>of you NEAT people could beat me to it if you got
>crackin'. :)

Can we have a bit more detail?

What will your inputs and outputs be?
How many symbols and how will you distinguish presenting the symbols from 
retrieving them?
Will the sequence be temporal or spatial?

         Ian Badcoe
